intro: Andrachne maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan sandweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa, particularly Morocco. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the spring. Andrachne maroccana is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
